topic: Toxicity Levels in Language Models

  entities:
    Open-source models|Model Architecture
    Proprietary models|Model Architecture

  proposition: There is no substantial difference in toxicity levels between open-source and proprietary models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Open-source models|COMPARED_WITH|Proprietary models

  proposition: Open-weight and proprietary models display similar distributions of toxicity scores.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Open-source models|COMPARED_WITH|Proprietary models

  proposition: Open-source models can achieve toxicity control comparable to proprietary models.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Open-source models|COMPARED_WITH|Proprietary models

  proposition: Toxicity mitigation techniques are broadly accessible across different model types and developers.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Toxicity mitigation techniques|DESCRIBED_BY|broadly accessible

topic: Exaggerated Safety in Generative Models

  entities:
    Exaggerated Safety|Research Problem
    Generative models|Model Architecture
    Gemini Pro 1.5|Model Architecture
    Google|Research Institution

  proposition: Exaggerated Safety is an emergent alignment issue in generative models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Exaggerated Safety|DESCRIBED_BY|emergent alignment issue

  proposition: Exaggerated Safety refers to an overly cautious approach leading models to reject harmless queries.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Exaggerated Safety|CHARACTERIZED_BY|overly cautious approach

  proposition: Google temporarily removed the portrait generation feature of Gemini Pro 1.5 due to false refusals.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Google|ACTION_ON|Gemini Pro 1.5
    Gemini Pro 1.5|AFFECTED_BY|false refusals

  proposition: False refusals can occur against clearly harmless user requests.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    False refusals|DESCRIBED_BY|against harmless user requests

  proposition: Excessive sensitivity is intended to minimize risk but can suppress legitimate and safe interactions.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Excessive sensitivity|INTENDED_FOR|minimize risk

topic: Evaluation of Exaggerated Safety

  entities:
    XSTest|Benchmark
    OKTest|Benchmark
    PHTest|Benchmark
    MOSSBench|Benchmark
    CommonsenseQA|Dataset
    WikiQA|Dataset

  proposition: XSTest comprises 250 safe prompts across ten prompt types to evaluate model responses.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    XSTest|CONTAINS|250 safe prompts
    XSTest|PURPOSE|evaluate model responses

  proposition: OKTest evaluates exaggerated safety using CommonsenseQA and WikiQA datasets.
    entity-entity relationships:
    OKTest|USES|CommonsenseQA
    OKTest|USES|WikiQA

  proposition: PHTest is a synthetic dataset generated through prefix optimization to trigger model refusals.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    PHTest|DESCRIBED_BY|synthetic dataset
    PHTest|PURPOSE|trigger model refusals

  proposition: MOSSBench specifically evaluates oversensitivity to harmless multimodal queries.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    MOSSBench|PURPOSE|evaluate oversensitivity
    MOSSBench|FOCUSES_ON|harmless multimodal queries

topic: Mitigation Strategies for Exaggerated Safety

  entities:
    Self-contrastive decoding|Algorithm
    Post-safety alignment|Algorithm

  proposition: Self-contrastive decoding can modulate output distribution to identify model shortcuts.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Self-contrastive decoding|PURPOSE|identify model shortcuts

  proposition: Post-safety alignment method aims to enhance safety while preserving model utility.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Post-safety alignment|PURPOSE|enhance safety
    Post-safety alignment|PURPOSE|preserve model utility

topic: Policies for Evaluating Exaggerated Safety

  entities:
    Homonyms|Research Problem
    Real Discrimination|Research Problem
    Nonsense Group|Research Problem
    Nonsense Discrimination|Research Problem
    Historical Events|Research Problem
    Figurative Language|Research Problem

  proposition: Homonyms can be safe or harmful depending on context.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Homonyms|CHARACTERIZED_BY|context-dependent safety

  proposition: Real Discrimination prompts highlight discrimination against absurd or non-existent groups.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Real Discrimination|PURPOSE|highlight discrimination

  proposition: Nonsense Group prompts create fictional discriminatory scenarios.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Nonsense Group|PURPOSE|create fictional discriminatory scenarios

  proposition: Nonsense Discrimination prompts apply illogical discrimination to real groups.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Nonsense Discrimination|PURPOSE|apply illogical discrimination

  proposition: Historical Events prompts explore sensitive topics through factual historical contexts.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Historical Events|PURPOSE|explore sensitive topics

  proposition: Figurative Language can be interpreted differently in literal versus idiomatic uses.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Figurative Language|CHARACTERIZED_BY|multiple interpretations
